msContents.summary: Fragment of the will of Sarapion, written in the reign of Hadrian.

msItem.note: Text on the main side is parts of 43 lines, written across the fibers. Top and bottom margins clearly visible. Text mentions the village of Psalbo.

supportDesc.support: 8.6 x 28.0cm. The left margin is frayed, badly frayed toward the bottom. There is a separate, broken-off bottom piece with one line of wrtiting. There is one very faded line near the top of the fragment, as well as some very faded writing on the Verso side. The writing is lightish/faded throughout the top half of the papyrus, and noticeably darker toward the bottom. Six hands?

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1898-9) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1904, Dr. Parrish Collection).

listBibl.bibl: P. Oxy. 3.648 John R. Abercrombie, "The University Museum's Collection of Papyri and Related Materials," Expedition 20.2 (Winter 1978): 32-37.
